fields.description:
Crucible often hangs or is very slow for many users.  This seems to occur when there is review creation activity happening.   we have > 600 users and the larger teams are experiencing slow crucible response times.  In general, the feedback has been its slow (most) to unusable (some.).   

we restart crucible with a nighly crontab. 
- It causes JIRA issue views to time out (apache proxy times out) when the "Unreviewed Code Condition" is active for example.
- Timeouts in JIRA issues (when viewsing source or review tab)
- Timeouts showing changsets in the project vew
fields.summary: Crucible regularly hangs and is very slow

fields.description: see screenshot
fields.summary: Dropdown arrow overlap in branch filter

!http://img.skitch.com/20101012-knx4j3q34gy1nm5h9f5rwnu3tr.png!

Logging out and back in made no difference.

Note that the name I gave the JIRA server when I created the link was incorrect - you'll see 4.1.2 in the hover error message, but it's actually 4.2rc1.

fields.description:
If you create a review with the RestReviewService, then call the function rest-service/reviews-v1/<permid>/reviewitems  then occasionally the fileType and commitType fields of the response will be set to "Unknown" instead of the actual values.

To reproduce, remove the two lines marked as a work around in RestReviewServiceTest.testReviewItems(). Then run the RestReviewServiceTest functional tests twice to see the behaviour.
fields.summary: FileType and CommitType components of ExpandedRevisions in ReviewItemRevisionData often comes back as "Unknown" shortly after a review is created.

I was looking for an answer, but wasn't trivial to fix (tried setting display on all its children to inline-block and inline).

fields.description:
If you update the configuration of non-enabled repository and then starts the reindexing (by clicking on "Perform" in the popup notifying you have to reindex), a GWT error is shown:

!Error.jpg!

Steps in the admin screen:
* desactivate a repo
* click on "View" to edit its settings
* then save
* click on "Perform" when asked to reindex
fields.summary: After updating a repo config, an error is shown if the user starts the reindex on disactivated repo

fields.description:
On the file history page, the link 'Diff to previous' is displayed for moved files. This triggers a compare of 2 revisions that have different paths. As a result one of the revisions can't be resolved (because we search for revisions for a path) and an error message is displayed.

Either the 'Diff to previous' shouldn't be displayed if the paths of the revisions to compare don't match, or we should also be passing the paths as parameters..
fields.summary: Diff to previous doesn't work for moved files

fields.description:
The background position is -125px and the gradient starts at ~135px, which means the top ~10px are all white (hard to notice, possibly on purpose).
If a scrollbar is necessary, anything below 195px is also all white (definitely not on purpose).

We should decide if we want to:
- Use a new image with a longer gradient with darker endpoint (add dark colors to the bottom, don't stretch current endpoints, long version will be too dark?)
- Use a new image with a longer, stretched gradient (non-scrollbar version will be too light?)
- Use a new image with a longer, stretched gradient ONLY when a scrollbar is present (much more effort)
- Secret fourth option.

!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/6ab0e62a-21aa-4979-8f50-f75890dff39b/2010-10-11_1442.png!
fields.summary: The gradient background on a Crucible Review header (<div class="frx-header" />) is only about 60px tall, which is less than the div's height

fields.description: e.g. https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/plugins/servlet/review-coverage/FE-hg/src/java and https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/plugins/servlet/code-metrics/FE-hg/src/java
fields.summary: Plugins (CodeMetrics/ReviewCoverage) are path sensitive but rendered without file tree

fields.description:
If you create a backup with the "repository and application caches" flag set, it's unable to be restored on a new instance.  The following error is thrown during the restore process:

{noformat}
...
Extracting cache/var/cache/FECRUPlugin/hgfelog/hgFeGenTestData.py (4K)...
Extracting cache/var/cache/FECRUPlugin/hgfelog/hgfelog_currentRepoTest.py (635B)...
Replacing existing cache for deleteme.txt...
ERROR: problem running command
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.mainImpl(FishEyeCtl.java:106)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.main(FishEyeCtl.java:39)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.util.FileUtils.deleteTree(FileUtils.java:30)
        at com.atlassian.crucible.migration.item.FishEyeCacheBackup$1.restore(FishEyeCacheBackup.java:150)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Restore.run(Restore.java:157)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Restore.main(Restore.java:212)
        ... 6 more
{noformat}

To reproduce:

# Create a backup with the "repository and application caches" flag set.
# Try to restore the backup in a new instance:
{noformat}./fisheyectl.sh restore -f /usr/local/fecru/fecru-2.3.6/backup/backup_2010-08-10_1329.zip -t built-in{noformat}
fields.summary: Cannot restore backups with cache data

This feature should be re-enabled.

fields.description: See title.
fields.summary: Don't show committers for disabled repositories in user dropdowns.

fields.description:
You only see the new file's name.  You don't see anything to indicate that the new file is a copy of some other file or that the file was previously named X but has now been moved to Y.  I've see this in git patchsets, although this bug may not be git-specific.

When you run "git config diff.renames copies", git will check to see whether a file is a result of copying another file.  This is very useful when you want to take one excessively large file, and split it up into two or more pieces.  It would be even more useful if Crucible showed something to indicate this.
fields.summary: when a git patchset contains a file that has been moved or copied, Crucible does not indicate this in the review

fields.description:
Because I can't delete a patchset from a review, I'll just upload a new patchset with corrected files and uncheck all the files in the old patchset.  Some files that have had comments won't delete, although others will.  I haven't looked into the problem too much, but it seems like when I can't delete a file, it falls into one of these two scenarios:

(1) the file has a comment, I tried to uncheck the file and fail, and then I go delete the comment and the file still fails to uncheck.
(2) I upload the new patchset, add a comment to the same file but in the new patchset, and then I can't delete the file in the old patchset, even if I delete the comment from the file in the new patchset.

There may also be some relation to whether I first tried unchecking it from within the draft review mode tree-view versus from within the "Add Content" popup.
fields.summary: can't always delete/uncheck a file from a review if that file has a deleted comment

fields.description: this will lead to a poor setup experience because performance will be bad.
fields.summary: [admin/SVN] "Use built-in symbolic rules" not checked by default when adding an SVN repo

fields.description:
When starting FishEye or Crucible for the very first time, we could still make the following improvements to the logging a user sees in the console:

* correctly log the host address. it currently prints http://hostaddress:8060 early in the sequence - and should really only do this once, when Jetty and the plugin system is actually ready to serve requests
* fix the logging around "Starting database...". Also investigate any possibly performance improvements that could be made here - such as pre-OSGiing the bundled plugins? In any regards - we could be more descriptive around what is going on here.
fields.summary: More setup improvements

fields.description:
If a branch filter is applied in the current file history view, no revisions are shown unless they are on the filtered branch.  While this is OK, we need an accompanying option to show that file's revisions "back to the beginning" which could be on a parent/ancestor branch.

One possibility is to change the "include other branches" button to be "include parent branches" (or another appropriate phrase).  The current "include other branches" is activity for that file across all branches, and that can already be seen by clicking the "all" button on the branch filter.
fields.summary: Need option to show file history including ancestors

fields.description:
When clicking a repository in the GWT admin, the following error occurred:

{noformat}
     [java] 15:06:47 ERROR - Unable to show dialog:com.google.gwt.core.client.impl.AsyncFragmentLoader$HttpDownloadFailure: HTTP download failed with status 404
     [java]         Unknown.o_b(Unknown source:0)
     [java]         Unknown.L_b(Unknown source:0)
     [java]         Unknown.<anonymous>(Unknown source:0)
     [java]         Unknown.S_b(Unknown source:0)
     [java]         Unknown.onreadystatechange(Unknown source:0)
{noformat}

This happened after clicking the repository after just adding a ClearCase repository. After reloading the page, the link could be clicked again.

A pre-release customer for ClearCase is reporting the same issues (intermittently occurring errors in the GWT admin)
fields.summary: GWT admin error: nable to show dialog:com.google.gwt.core.client.impl.AsyncFragmentLoader$HttpDownloadFailure: HTTP download failed with status 404

fields.description:
Created by Michael Heemskerk from Jason Hinch's Crucible comment https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-4180#c36007 :

We should probably explicitly say in the activity stream that no files were modified in the changeset

example: !http://img.skitch.com/20101001-b1rwjx16uk6325q253ewjbg4kg.jpg!

!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/d6ef73ee-f629-4df0-b414-b6899dea1c4a/2010-10-05_1008.png!

Perhaps the masthead should be given the same min-width as it's content.  This could change client-side depending on whether the left-pane is open and whether the commit filter is open, so we'd have to do it via JS.
fields.summary: The masthead always fits viewport, but the content has a min-width set.

fields.description: This would cause a permanent horizontal scrollbar for anyone viewing it on a 1024px width monitor.

fields.description:
The problem is that when you add a few revisions they all get smashed together: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20101001-qm3x7e2c7dpuujuj99g6h95uy9.jpg! 


Considering the local revision number is possibly not valid for a developers clone of the repo, we could probably just ditch it and show only the shortened changeset id (the bit after the colon) to free up a bit of space. 

In any case white space should be added between each revision.
fields.summary: Changeset IDs aren't very usable in the revision slider with Hg/DVCS

fields.description:
Classification: Factually incorrect

Created by Michael Heemskerk from Crucible defect on WaybackSpec.java line 117 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-4154#c36010 :

for hg and git we're re-creating the E_HEAD_IN_BRANCH_TO_REVID after each slurp that found new changesets. These indexes however aren't being re-created. As a result revisions that are silently merged in (i.e. without conflicts) are missed by this condition.

This query is only being used for determining whether a file is empty. When getting the file contents a different query is being used, which is wrong I think...

Marked as defect because I need to track down usages of E_UNMOD_ON_BRANCH_TO_REVID and possibly refactor them or re-generate the E_UNMOD_ON_BRANCH_.. as well
fields.summary: for hg and git we're re-creating the E_HEAD_IN_BRANCH_TO_REVID after each slurp that found new changesets. These indexes however aren't being re-created. As a result revisions that are silently merged in (i.e. without conflicts) are missed by this cond...

fields.description:
I've managed to replicate this with a p4 repo. 


The history of the file in p4 shows: 

{noformat}[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 filelog  //depot/branches/8.0/bsd.txt 
//depot/branches/8.0/bsd.txt
... #2 change 76 integrate on 2010/10/01 by amyers@erdinger (text) 'merging '
... ... copy from //depot/main/bsd.txt#2
... #1 change 74 branch on 2010/10/01 by amyers@erdinger (text) 'merge to branch '
... ... branch from //depot/main/bsd.txt#1{noformat} 


What I did on the repo: 

{noformat}

[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 add bsd.txt 
//depot/main/bsd.txt#1 - opened for add

... add content to file ...

[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 submit 
Change 73 created with 1 open file(s).
Submitting change 73.
Locking 1 files ...
add //depot/main/bsd.txt#1
Change 73 submitted.


[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 integ //depot/main/... //depot/branches/8.0/... 
[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 submit 
Change 74 created with 1 open file(s).
Submitting change 74.
Locking 1 files ...
branch //depot/branches/8.0/bsd.txt#1
Change 74 submitted.


[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 edit bsd.txt 
//depot/main/bsd.txt#1 - opened for edit

... make change to file ... 

[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 submit 
Change 75 created with 1 open file(s).
Submitting change 75.
Locking 1 files ...
edit //depot/main/bsd.txt#2
Change 75 submitted.

[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 integ //depot/main/... //depot/branches/8.0/... 
//depot/branches/8.0/bsd.txt#1 - integrate from //depot/main/bsd.txt#2
[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 resolve
/Users/amyers/p4reps/test-project/branches/8.0/bsd.txt - merging //depot/main/bsd.txt#2
Diff chunks: 0 yours + 1 theirs + 0 both + 0 conflicting
Accept(a) Edit(e) Diff(d) Merge (m) Skip(s) Help(?) at: dt 
1c1
< Copyright (c) <year>, <copyright holder>
---
> Copyright (c) 2010, Andrew Myers
Accept(a) Edit(e) Diff(d) Merge (m) Skip(s) Help(?) at: at 
//erdinger/branches/8.0/bsd.txt - copy from //depot/main/bsd.txt
[amyers@erdinger:main]$ p4 submit 
Change 76 created with 1 open file(s).
Submitting change 76.
Locking 1 files ...
integrate //depot/branches/8.0/bsd.txt#2
Change 76 submitted.{noformat}


Creating a review from the FishEye changeset 76 works correctly:

!http://img.skitch.com/20101001-gmcffw4y9x2esryh5kduyx847p.jpg! 

But if I create the review in crucible, select only the file in changeset 76:

!http://img.skitch.com/20101001-rx3423tq4797k7d8thpecyi63n.jpg! 

I then use the "Add Revisions" option to add changeset 74 to the review:

!http://img.skitch.com/20101001-pwa9xepaq6fa3x8k36mx6ce4pg.jpg! 

And bsd.txt will now show up twice in the directory tree as per the following screenshot:

!http://img.skitch.com/20101001-nnm65nuw89xnpwtmp5t1nj1jia.jpg! 

Something is going wrong with the "Add Revisions" option that makes it think the old revision is a different file.
fields.summary: Same file shows up twice in a review

fields.description:
In the Confluence docs, a reviewer is defined as

bq. A reviewer is a person assigned to review the change. Reviewers can make comments and indicate when they have completed their review. The moderator and author are implicitly considered reviewers.

This is incorrect; the moderator and author are not considered to be reviewers, the last sentence should be changed to:

bq. The moderator and author are implicitly considered participants of the review, but are not reviewers.

Affected page:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/reviewer
fields.summary: Definition of 'Reviewer' in the docs is incorrect

fields.description:
FECRU gadgets have all been broken more times than I can remember,and every time the breakage has gone unnoticed for weeks. 


Currently, we have no way of verifying that our gadgets work, and since we don't use them noone will notice. There's a high risk of making releases where we break all gadgets. 

We need to set up some sort of gadget functional testing. Possibly using the ref app to verify our gadgets are working as expected. 

It is highly important that we also test that Oauth is working.
fields.summary: Set up functional tests for FECRU gadgets

*I know of atleast one.
fields.summary: The gadget OAUTH url has changed. Change it back for backwards compatibility.
PermissionScheme.calculateRequiresModerator throws NullPointerException

fields.description: Create a new project in Crucible. The screen that displays is titled 'Edit Project'. It should be titled 'Create Project'.
fields.summary: Create project screen should be titled 'Create Project' not 'Edit Project'

fields.description:
The Fisheye and Crucible API allow you to gather Repository Details.
For Crucible it is via the rest-services/repositories-v1 option. 
For Fisheye it is via the rest-services-fe/repositories-v1 option.

However the Fisheye (FE) rest-services-fe only provides repository name and running state.   Crucible API provides the details on the Fisheye repository.   There is no way to get server, path, or other details on a repository in Fisheye with out a License for Crucible.

Making a dedicated Fisheye (no Crucible) instance is impossible due to the requirement for the license IF you want to get management details such as paths
fields.summary: Repository Details only avaliable with CRUCIBLE License in Fisheye

fields.description:
A visit to permalink to a comment e.g. http://localhost:8060/cru/CR-2#c3 does not autoscroll the browser to the correct location.

In some situation, the autoscroll works but the browser will immediately re-scroll to the top as if the anchor has lose focus.

This also happens in 2.2.3 (JIRA Studio), however, without the immediate re-scroll described above.
fields.summary: Anchor is broken in general comments

fields.description:
At:

http://localhost:6060/foo/changelog/~br=br-6168/sanity1/test/funny%23dir/dir?max=30&view=fe

with sanity1 repo

Link to funny#dir in breadcrumbs goes to the wrong place and tooltip shows %23 instead of #
fields.summary: Broken Link encoding in breadcrumbs
Clicking on cog drop-down icon in activity stream does nothing in IE8

fields.description:
Clicking this link

https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/src/java/com/cenqua/crucible/hibernate/DBControlFactoryImpl.java?r=57962#l110

you actually end up with a URL set to

https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/src/java/com/cenqua/crucible/hibernate/DBControlFactoryImpl.java?r=57962#undefined

The original URL does work correctly (in that you go to line 110)
fields.summary: Navigating to a annotated page with a line offset in the URL fragment gives an "undefined" in the URL

fields.description:
The current Hidden Directories doc needs some examples of the include/exclude patterns used:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Hidden+Directories
fields.summary: Add include/exclude pattern examples to Hidden Directories document for FishEye

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Allow+%28Process%29 needs additional details around how and when the inclusion/exclusion rules are applied.

{panel}
David Corley says:

Having set up exclusion rules, and seen them not work, I checked the forums to find Matt Watsons comment here:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257335942&#257335942

I think the documentation needs to be updated to:

1. Break down the phases of the initial scan and explain what each phase is for (creating changeset,index,generating linecount ,etc.). It would be really useful to know what to expect.

2. Define which phase(s) actually apply the include/exclude rules. (it seems the "creating changesets" phase does not, but later phases do)
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow (Process) document needs more detail on how/when inclusion/exclusion rules are applied

fields.description:
Error log contains some ERROR messages which seems as caused by "normal" user validation and shouldn't be in error log.

2010-09-19 13:09:53,758 ERROR [btpool0-4376] fisheye.app com.cenqua.fisheye.web.WaybackSpecChart$Params-getObject - Error parsing date string arigons3456@gmail.com
java.text.ParseException: Unparseable date: "arigons3456@gmail.com"
	at java.text.DateFormat.parse(DateFormat.java:337)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.WaybackSpecChart$Params.getObject(WaybackSpecChart.java:467)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.WaybackSpecChart.fromRequest(WaybackSpecChart.java:160)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.WaybackSpecChart.fromRequest(WaybackSpecChart.java:138)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ChartPageAction.handleWaybackJump(ChartPageAction.java:40)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ChartPageAction.handleRequest(ChartPageAction.java:56)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.BaseAction.processRequest(BaseAction.java:181)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ActionDispatcherServlet.doIt(ActionDispatcherServlet.java:224)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ActionDispatcherServlet.doGet(ActionDispatcherServlet.java:55)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:707)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:820)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.handle(ServletHolder.java:502)

fields.description: As a Crucible user, I think it is critical to filter comments based favorite selection, so user  can download or view comments base on user's favorite selection
fields.summary: View/download comments based on favorites as a filter

fields.description: As a Crucible user, I'd like Crucible to have a user setting of double clicking to comment on code, other than the single click to comment. IT is a kind of annoying for the later.
fields.summary: double click to comment
Users page doesnt respect wbspec

fields.description:
Whilst full blown freemarker support would be nice, an interim step would be to use the html syntax highlighting for ftl files.  

This is on the assumption that the html syntax highlighter just ignores the freemarker and doesn't munge it all up.
fields.summary: Use html syntax highlighting for .ftl files
